subjective_questions.question_text: Explain the physical properties of metals and non-metals with examples.
subjective_questions.subject: Science
rubric: List at least three physical properties of metals
List at least three physical properties of non-metals
Provide suitable examples for both

subjective_questions.question_text: Describe the reactivity series of metals. How does it help in predicting displacement reactions?
subjective_questions.subject: Science
rubric: Define the reactivity series
Explain its significance in displacement reactions
Provide a relevant example with a balanced equation

subjective_questions.question_text: How is corrosion of metals prevented? Explain any two methods.
subjective_questions.subject: Science
rubric: Define corrosion and explain its causes
Describe at least two prevention methods
Provide examples of each method

subjective_questions.question_text: Why do ionic compounds have high melting and boiling points?
subjective_questions.subject: Science
rubric: Define ionic compounds and their formation
Explain the role of electrostatic forces
Provide a real-world example

subjective_questions.question_text: What is an alloy? Give two examples and their uses.
subjective_questions.subject: Science
rubric: Define alloy and its composition
Give two examples of alloys
Mention their uses

subjective_questions.question_text: Explain how metals react with acids and bases. Provide balanced equations.
subjective_questions.subject: Science
rubric: Explain reaction of metals with acids
Explain reaction of metals with bases
Provide balanced chemical equations for both

subjective_questions.question_text: Describe the extraction of metals from their ores through reduction and refining processes.
subjective_questions.subject: Science
rubric: Explain the process of reduction in extraction
Describe refining with an example
Provide a real-world application

subjective_questions.question_text: What are amphoteric oxides? Give two examples with reactions.
subjective_questions.subject: Science
rubric: Define amphoteric oxides
Give two examples
Provide their reactions with acids and bases

subjective_questions.question_text: Why is sodium stored in kerosene but iron is not?
subjective_questions.subject: Science
rubric: Explain the reactivity of sodium
Describe how kerosene prevents sodium from reacting
Compare with iron and explain why it does not require special storage

subjective_questions.question_text: How does the electronic configuration of metals and non-metals affect their chemical properties?
subjective_questions.subject: Science
rubric: Explain the general electronic configuration of metals
Explain the general electronic configuration of non-metals
Describe how these configurations determine reactivity

objective_questions.subject: Science

objective_questions.question_text: Which non-metal is a good conductor of electricity?
